message.div: Please activate javascript, logout, reload page and login again. Sorry, but you'll need javascript. ${page-content}

div.p: The SOC allows officers to fulfill important tasks to keep the current mission on track.
Therefore, the SOC provides key services like the Starship Configuration Center, Planet Database, Logbook Generator, Holodeck Program Database and Kartographic Services.
The services were planned and implemented taking into account the latest 23rd century security findings!
K-SAP enables Klingon Strategic Operations Officers to easily manage their spaceship fleet.
Using K-SAP, one can store spaceships with a specified key and list spaceships stored with the specified key. The concrete usage is displayed after a successful login to the service.

Unlike humans, Klingons like to interact with a computer in a very old-fashioned way, called CLI. To manage the fleet using K-SAP, a connection to Port 8449 using a Client/Server-Protocol has to be established.

p.strong: Welcome to the AI Engine of the Spaceship

div.p: After you register, you can create fascinating artifical intelligence powered navigating software with the newest high-level programming language "x86 Assembly Subset" and it will be able to navigate you through the galaxy while you are lying hibernated in the back part of the ship.
As there are more programmers on this huge Spaceship, of course there will be other users on this server as well - naturally, in a perfectly separated environment.
Connect through the bleeding edge raw TCP/IP protocol on port 4545!
You can find more information about the programming in the DOCUMENTATION file.

div.h2: Welcome to the Advanced Space Communication Service!
div.p: Chat with your favorite enemy klingon Leader, declare war on other ships and much more!

Connect to the spacecom Server on your Spaceship with the best chat client ever: spacecom_client.py, you will find the client in the home dir of spacecomservice. Client connects to your own chatserver on default port 9999, for other options check the client usage
div.pre:
usage: spacecom_client.py [-h] [-s [Host]] [-p [Port]] [-u [Nick]] usage: spacecom_client.py [-h] [-s [Host]] [-p [Port]] [-u [Nick]]
optional arguments: -h, --help show this help message and exit -s [Host], --server [Host] server ip or hostname (default: localhost) -p [Port], --port [Port] serverport to use (default: 9999) -u [Nick], --user [Nick] username (default: None)

messages.message:
Checklist server

Spaceship starts and missions to undiscovered areas of the universe need a lot of tasks to be carried out in the right order. Now there is the new checklist server to save all your important steps. With a secret passcode you can protect your confidential information.

You may use this private key for connecting to ssh port 220 with user checklist:

-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
Please note:
You must not revoke access rights for this key!
Confidentiality for this key is still present since it is available to authorized starfleet commanders.

These commands are available to manage your checklists on the server:

  • Command "list":
    Display a list of the 30 latest checklist entries.
  • Command "insert <sequence-number> <passcode> <value>":
    Insert a new entry in checklist.
    <sequence-number> must consist of 10 to 30 numeric characters.
    <passcode> must consist of 10 to 30 alphanumeric characters.
    <value> must consist of 1 to 120 alphanumeric characters.
    There must not be duplicate entries for the same sequence number.
  • Command "read <sequence-number> <passcode>":
    Shows value of entry which is identified by sequence-number and passcode.
    <sequence-number> must consist of 10 to 30 numeric characters.
    <passcode> must consist of 10 to 30 alphanumeric characters.
  • Command "help":
    Show some help text.

li.a: Background image (Credit: NASA, ESA and Jesús Maíz Apellániz (Instituto de Astrofísica de Andalucía, Spain)

message.p: The SOC allows officers to fulfill important tasks to keep the current mission on track.
Therefore, the SOC provides key services like the Starship Configuration Center, Planet Database, Logbook Generator, Holodeck Program Database and Kartographic Services.
The services were planned and implemented taking into account the latest 23rd century security findings!
Access to the SOC is for authenticated startfleet officers only!
